translation: (Now being the description of the killing of Mehdi Mir)

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਕੈ ਤਿਹ ਨਾਸ ॥ ਕੀਅ ਸੱਤਜੁਗ ਪਰਗਾਸ ॥ ਕਲਜੁੱਗ ਸਰਬ ਬਿਹਾਨ ॥ ਨਿਜ ਜੋਤ ਸਮਾਨ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Kai Tih Naas|| Keea Sattjoug Pargads|| Kaljougg Sarab Bihaan|| Nij Jot Jot Samaan||1
translation: In the way, destroying him, the age of the truth was manifested; the whole of Iron Age had passed away and the light manifested itself everywhere consistently .1

gurmukhi: ਮਹਿਦੀ ਭਰਯੋ ਤਬ ਗਰਬ ॥ ਜਗ ਜੀਤਯੋ ਜਬ ਸਰਬ ॥ ਸਿਰ ਅੱਤ੍ਰ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਫਿਰਾੲਿ ॥ ਜਗ ਜੇਰ ਕੀਨ ਬਨਾੲਿ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Maihdibdaryo Tab Gadab|| Jag Jeetyo Jab Sarab|| Sir Attra Pattra Phiraae|| Jag Jer Keen Banaae||2||
translation: Then Mir Mehdi, conquering the whole world, was filled with pride; he also got the canopy swung over his head and caused the whole world to bow at his feet.2.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ਅਾਪ ਜਾਨ ਨ ਅੌਰ ॥ ਸਭ ਰੂਪ ਅੳੁ ਸਭ ਠੳੁਰ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਦਿਸ਼ਟ ਨ ਅਾਨ ॥ ਤਿਸ ਲੀਨ ਕਾਲ ਨਿਦਾਨ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Bin Aap Na Aur|| Sabh Roop Au Sabh Thaur|| Jin Ek Disht Na Aan|| Tis Leen Kaal Nidaan||3||
translation: Expect himself, he did not have faith in anyone; he who did not comprehend One Lord-God, he ultimately could not save himself from KAL(death).3.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਦੂਸਰ ਨਾਹਿ ॥ ਸਭ ਰੰਗ ਰੂਪਨ ਮਾਹਿ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਕੋ ਨ ਪਛਾਨ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਬ੍ਰਿਥਾ ਜਨਮ ਬਿਤਾਰ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Bin Ek Doosar Naah(i) || Sabh Ran Raapan Maah(i)|| Jin Ek Ko Na Pachhaad|| Tih Birthaa Janam Bitaan||4
translation: There is not one other in all colours and forms except one God; he, who has not recognized that one Lord, he wasted his birth.4.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਦੂਸਰ ਨ ਅੌਰ ॥ ਜਲ ਬਾ ਥਲੇ ਸਭ ਠੳੁਰ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਸੱਤਿ ਨ ਜਾਨ ॥ ਸੋ ਜੂਨ ਜੂਨ ਭ੍ਰਮਾਨ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Bin Ek Doosar Na Aur|| Jal Baa Dhale Sabh Thaur|| Jin Ek Satt(i) Na Jaan|| So Joon Joon Bhramaan||5||
translation: Expect that one Lord, there is none other in water, on plain and all the places; he who had not recognized the One Reality, he only roamed away amongst the Yogis.5.

gurmukhi: ਤਜ ੲੇਕ ਜਾਨਾ ਦੂਜ ॥ ਮਮ ਜਾਨ ਤਾਸ ਨ ਸੂਝ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਦੂਖ ਭੂਖ ਪਿਅਾਸ ॥ ਦਿਨ ਰੈਨ ਸਰਬ ੳੁਦਾਸ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Taj Ek Jaanaa Dooj|| Mam Jaan Taas Na Soojh|| Tih Dookh Bhookh Piaas|| Din Rain Sarab Udaas||6||
translation: He who leaving the one, believed in another one, in my view, he is devoid of wisdom; he will be surrounded by suffering, hunger, thirst and anxiety throughout day and night.6.

gurmukhi: ਨਹਿ ਚੈਨ ਅੈਨ ਸੁ ਵਾਹਿ ॥ ਨਿਤ ਰੋਗ ਹੋਵਤ ਤਾਹਿ ॥ ਨਿਤ ਦੂਖ ਭੂਖ ਮਰੰਤ ॥ ਨਹਿ ਚੈਨ ਦਿੳੁਸ ਬਿਤੰਤ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Nah(i) Chain Ain Su Vaah(i)|| Nit Rog Hovat Taah(i)|| Nit Dookh Bhookh Marant|| Nah(i) Chain Dios Bitant||7||
translation: He will never get peace and will always be surrounded by ailments; he will always suffer death on account of suffering and hunger; he will always remain restless.7.

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਪਾਦ ਕੁਸ਼ਟ ਚਲੰਤ ॥ ਬਪੁ ਗਲਤ ਨਿੱਤ ਗਲੰਤ ॥ ਨਹਿ ਨਿੱਤ ਦੇਹ ਅਰੋਗ ॥ ਨਿਤ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਪੌਤ੍ਰਨ ਸੋਗ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Tan Paad Kousht Chalant|| Bap(u) Gadat Nitt Gadant|| Nah(i) Nitt Dehdarog|| Nit Poutra Paoutra Sog||8
translation: The leprosy will prevail in his body and all his body will rot; his body will not remain health and his foundness for sons and grandson will always afflict him.8.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਤ ਨਾਸ ਤਿਹ ਪਰਵਾਰ ॥ ਨਹਿ ਅੰਤ ਦੇਹ ੳੁਧਾਰ ॥ ਨਿਤ ਰੋਗ ਸੋਗ ਗ੍ਰਸੰਤ ॥ ਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਸ੍ਵਾਨ ਅੰਤ ਮਰੰਤ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Nit Naas Tih Parvaar|| Nah(i) Ant Deh Udhaar|| Nit Rog Sog Grasant|| Mrit Svaan Ant Marant||9||
translation: His family will be destroyed and at the and, his body will not be redeemed also; he will always be engrossed in disease and sorrow; ultimately, he will die the death of a dog .9.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਜਾਨ ਕਾਲ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਮਾਰਿਓ ਕਰਿ ਦੀਨ ॥ ੲਿਕ ਕੀਟ ਦੀਨ ੳੁਪਾੲਿ ॥ ਤਿਸ ਕਾਨ ਪੈਠੋ ਜਾੲਿ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Tab Jaan Kaal Prabeen|| Tih Maario Kar(i) Deen|| Ik Keet Keen Oupaae|| Tis Kaan Paitho Jaae||10||
translation: Reflecting over the egoistic state of Mir Mehdi the Unmanifested Brahman thought of killing him; he created an insect, which entered the ear of Mir Mehdi.10.

gurmukhi: ਧਸਿ ਕੀਟ ਕਾਨਨ ਬੀਚ ॥ ਤਿਸ ਜੀਤਯੋ ਜਿਮ ਨੀਚ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਦੇ ਦੁਖ ਤਾਹਿ ॥ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਮਾਰਿਓ ਵਾਹਿ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Dhas(i) Keet Kaanan Beech|| Tis Jeetyo Jim Neech|| Bahu Bhaant De Doukh Taah(i)|| Eh Bhaant Maario Vaah(i)||11
translation: Entering his ear, that insect conquered that base fellow, and giving him various types of suffering, killed him in this way.11.
The Lord is One and He can be realized through the
